  • Method Details

    • addSchemaToProject

      public SchemasApi.AddSchemaToProjectAdapter addSchemaToProject(String schemaHrn, com.here.platform.data.client.base.generated.scaladsl.model.artifact.AddSchemaToProjectRequest addSchemaToProjectRequest)
      Add schema and all related artifacts to the project by using a non scoped token.

      Path: /schema/{schemaHrn}/projectHome

      Method: PUT

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : GetProjectSchemaResponse (OK)

      code 400 : (Invalid add schema request was provided)

      code 401 : HapiCompliantSystemError (You are not authorized to view the schema or have wrong / invalid credentials)

      code 403 : ErrorResponse (Accessing the schema is forbidden)

      code 404 : (Not Found)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal server error. Support ticket should be created)

      Parameters:
      schemaHrn - The partial HRN of the schema. Full HRN (with version) may be used
      addSchemaToProjectRequest - Add schema to project request

    • addSchemaToProject

      public SchemasApi.AddSchemaToProjectBuilder addSchemaToProject()

    • addSchemaToResourcePolicy

      public SchemasApi.AddSchemaToResourcePolicyAdapter addSchemaToResourcePolicy(String schemaHrn, com.here.platform.data.client.base.generated.scaladsl.model.artifact.CreateResourcePolicyRequest createResourcePolicyRequest)
      Add schema and all attached artifacts to a newly created resource policy. This API works for tokens with or without a project scope. When the access token is project scoped, all the resources added to a resource policy must either be homed or referenced in the project.

      Path: /schema/{schemaHrn}/resourcePolicy

      Method: POST

      Expected answers:

      code 202 : AddSchemaToResourcePolicyResponse (Accepted)

      code 400 : (Invalid input provided)

      code 401 : (Access is denied due to invalid credentials)

      code 403 : (You do not have permission to perform this action)

      code 404 : (The resource you were trying to access was not found)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal server error. Support ticket should be created)

      Parameters:
      schemaHrn - The HRN of the schema
      createResourcePolicyRequest - Create resource policy request

    • addSchemaToResourcePolicy

      public SchemasApi.AddSchemaToResourcePolicyBuilder addSchemaToResourcePolicy()

    • deleteSchema

      public SchemasApi.DeleteSchemaAdapter deleteSchema(String hrn, String schemaHrn, Optional<Boolean> force)
      Delete the schema and related artifacts by given HRN. If scoped token is used, then the schema is deleted within the project the token belongs to. Partial HRN without version could be used. If more than one version of schema exists and partial HRN is passed then force flag must be set to true. By default force flag is set to false.

      Path: /schema/{schemaHrn}

      Method: DELETE

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : DeleteSchemaResponse (OK)

      code 400 : ErrorResponse (Invalid schema parameters were provided)

      code 401 : HapiCompliantSystemError (You are not authorized to view the schema or have wrong / invalid credentials)

      code 403 : (Accessing the schema is forbidden or this schema is currently associated with a catalog set as 'Ready for Marketplace' and cannot be deleted)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal server error. Support ticket should be created)

      Parameters:
      hrn - The HERE Resource Name (HRN) of the catalog.
      schemaHrn - The HRN of the schema
      force - The flag to force the deletion even if the schema is linked to a project

    • deleteSchema

      public SchemasApi.DeleteSchemaBuilder deleteSchema()

    • getSchema

      public SchemasApi.GetSchemaAdapter getSchema(String schemaHrn)
      Return the information about schema (hrn, groupId, artifactId, version) and related artifact and variants for the given HRN. If scoped token is used, then the information about schema is returned within the project the token belongs to.

      Path: /schema/{schemaHrn}

      Method: GET

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : GetSchemaResponse (OK)

      code 401 : HapiCompliantSystemError (You are not authorized to view the schema or have wrong / invalid credentials)

      code 403 : ErrorResponse (Accessing the schema is forbidden)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal server error. Support ticket should be created)

      Parameters:
      schemaHrn - The HRN of the schema

    • getSchema

      public SchemasApi.GetSchemaBuilder getSchema()

    • getSchemaDocument

      public SchemasApi.GetSchemaDocumentAdapter getSchemaDocument(String schemaHrn, String file)
      Return the url to schema documentation.

      Path: /schema/{schemaHrn}/doc/{file}

      Method: GET

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : String (OK)

      code 400 : ErrorResponse (Invalid schema parameters were provided)

      code 401 : HapiCompliantSystemError (You are not authorized to view the schema or have wrong / invalid credentials)

      code 403 : ErrorResponse (Accessing the schema is forbidden)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal server error. Support ticket should be created)

      Parameters:
      schemaHrn - The HRN of the schema
      file - The name of file

    • getSchemaMainMessage

      public SchemasApi.GetSchemaMainMessageAdapter getSchemaMainMessage(String schemaHrn)
      Return the binary data of main message file of the schema.

      Path: /schema/{schemaHrn}/message

      Method: GET

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : Array[Byte] (Main message file downloaded)

      code 400 : ErrorResponse (Invalid schema parameters were provided)

      code 401 : HapiCompliantSystemError (You are not authorized to view the schema or have wrong / invalid credentials)

      code 403 : ErrorResponse (Accessing the schema is forbidden)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal server error. Support ticket should be created)

      Parameters:
      schemaHrn - The HRN of the schema

    • linkSchemaToProject

      public SchemasApi.LinkSchemaToProjectAdapter linkSchemaToProject(String schemaHrn, Optional<com.here.platform.data.client.base.generated.scaladsl.model.artifact.LinkSchemaToProjectRequest> linkSchemaToProjectRequest)
      Link schema and all attached Artifacts to a linkable project. This API works for tokens with or without a project scope. If scoped token is used, the project hrn is implied from the scope, any other project hrns are rejected.

      Path: /schema/{schemaHrn}/links

      Method: POST

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : LinkSchemaToProjectResponse (OK)

      code 400 : (Invalid link request was provided)

      code 401 : HapiCompliantSystemError (You are not authorized to view the schema or have wrong / invalid credentials)

      code 403 : ErrorResponse (Accessing the schema is forbidden)

      code 404 : (Not Found)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal server error. Support ticket should be created)

      Parameters:
      schemaHrn - The partial HRN of the schema. Full HRN (with version) may be used
      linkSchemaToProjectRequest - Link schema to project request

    • linkSchemaToProject

      public SchemasApi.LinkSchemaToProjectBuilder linkSchemaToProject()

    • listSchemas

      public SchemasApi.ListSchemasAdapter listSchemas(Optional<String> access, Optional<String> sort, Optional<String> order, Optional<String> from, Optional<String> groupId, Optional<String> artifactId, Optional<Integer> limit, Optional<Long> offset, Optional<String> _type, Optional<Boolean> linkable, Optional<Boolean> layerSchema)
      Return the list of available schemas. If scoped token is used, then the list of schemas is returned within the project the token belongs to. If unscoped token is used, then the list of schemas is returned including the schemas belonging to the projects.

      Path: /schema

      Method: GET

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : ListSchemasResponse (OK)

      code 400 : (Invalid schema list parameters were provided)

      code 401 : HapiCompliantSystemError (You are not authorized to view the schema or have wrong / invalid credentials)

      code 403 : ErrorResponse (Accessing the schema is forbidden)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal server error. Support ticket should be created)

      Parameters:
      access - Comma separated list of access types (with OR semantic) to filter result.If 'default', returns schema user have read access to. If 'orgAdmin',returns catalogs OrgAdmin user have access to.
      sort - Applies sorting based on specified fields. Allowed values are group, name, version. Multiple fields must be separated with ':'
      order - Applies ordering. Defaults is ASC
      from - Applies 'greater than' filtering to fields specified in 'sort' property. For example when 'sort' property is 'name:version' and 'from' is 'b:1.0.0' then the response will contain records with a name starting from 'b' till 'z' and version greater than 1.0.0
      groupId - Applies filtering based on groupId
      artifactId - Applies filtering based on artifactId
      limit - Specifies the maximum amount of records that could be returned. Default is 20
      offset - Specifies how many records will be skipped at the beginning. Default is 0
      _type - Applies filtering based on schema type
      linkable - Indicates if the response should only return the list of linkable schemas. Note: - If set to 'true' and the access token has a project scope, then the response will include the schemas that are available to the caller to link to the project in the token's project scope and HERE public schemas. - If set to 'true' and the access token has no scope, then the response will include all HERE public schema only.\"
      layerSchema - Indicates if the response should only return the list of layer schemas. If value set to false the response will also include non-layer schemas

    • listSchemas

      public SchemasApi.ListSchemasBuilder listSchemas()

    • makeSchemaLinkable

      public SchemasApi.MakeSchemaLinkableAdapter makeSchemaLinkable(String schemaHrn, com.here.platform.data.client.base.generated.scaladsl.model.artifact.MakeSchemaLinkableRequest makeSchemaLinkableRequest)
      Make schema and all attached artifacts available for linking to a specific project or realm.

      Path: /schema/{schemaHrn}/linkable

      Method: POST

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : MakeSchemaLinkableResponse (OK)

      code 400 : (Invalid make linkable request was provided)

      code 401 : HapiCompliantSystemError (You are not authorized to view the schema or have wrong / invalid credentials)

      code 403 : ErrorResponse (Accessing the schema is forbidden)

      code 404 : (Not Found)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal server error. Support ticket should be created)

      Parameters:
      schemaHrn - The partial HRN of the schema. Full HRN (with version) may be used
      makeSchemaLinkableRequest - The linkable request

    • removeSchemaFromProject

      public SchemasApi.RemoveSchemaFromProjectAdapter removeSchemaFromProject(String schemaHrn)
      Remove schema and all related artifacts from the project resource home. Works only for schema that was migrated to the project

      Path: /schema/{schemaHrn}/projectHome

      Method: DELETE

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : GetProjectSchemaResponse (OK)

      code 400 : (Invalid remove schema request was provided)

      code 401 : HapiCompliantSystemError (You are not authorized to view the schema or have wrong / invalid credentials)

      code 403 : ErrorResponse (Accessing the schema is forbidden)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal server error. Support ticket should be created)

      Parameters:
      schemaHrn - The partial HRN of the schema. Full HRN (with version) may be used

    • removeSchemaLinkability

      public SchemasApi.RemoveSchemaLinkabilityAdapter removeSchemaLinkability(String schemaHrn, String targetHrn)

      Path: /schema/{schemaHrn}/linkable/{targetHrn}

      Method: DELETE

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : RemoveLinkabilityResponse (OK)

      code 400 : (Invalid remove linkability request was provided)

      code 401 : HapiCompliantSystemError (You are not authorized to view the schema or have wrong / invalid credentials)

      code 403 : ErrorResponse (Accessing the schema is forbidden)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal server error. Support ticket should be created)

      Parameters:
      schemaHrn - The partial HRN of the schema. Full HRN (with version) may be used
      targetHrn - The HRN of the target

    • unlinkSchemaFromProject

      public SchemasApi.UnlinkSchemaFromProjectAdapter unlinkSchemaFromProject(String schemaHrn, String projectHrn)
      Unlink schema and all attached Artifacts from the project it was previously linked. This API works for tokens with or without a project scope.

      Path: /schema/{schemaHrn}/links/{projectHrn}

      Method: DELETE

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : LinkSchemaToProjectResponse (OK)

      code 400 : (Invalid unlink request was provided)

      code 401 : HapiCompliantSystemError (You are not authorized to view the schema or have wrong / invalid credentials)

      code 403 : ErrorResponse (Accessing the schema is forbidden)

      code 404 : (Not Found)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal server error. Support ticket should be created)

      Parameters:
      schemaHrn - The partial HRN of the schema. Full HRN (with version) may be used
      projectHrn - The HRN of the project

    • unlinkSchemaFromProject

      public SchemasApi.UnlinkSchemaFromProjectBuilder unlinkSchemaFromProject()

    • updateSchemaPermission

      public SchemasApi.UpdateSchemaPermissionAdapter updateSchemaPermission(String schemaHrn, com.here.platform.data.client.base.generated.scaladsl.model.artifact.UpdatePermissionRequest updatePermissionRequest)
      Grant/revoke permissions for schema. READ grants 'readResource', MODIFY grants 'modifyResource', SHARE grants 'shareResource'.

      Path: /schema/{schemaHrn}/permission

      Method: POST

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : UpdatePermissionResponse (Permissions was updated)

      code 400 : ErrorResponse (Invalid schema parameters were provided)

      code 401 : HapiCompliantSystemError (You are not authorized to view the schema or have wrong / invalid credentials)

      code 403 : ErrorResponse (Accessing the schema is forbidden)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal server error. Support ticket should be created)

      Parameters:
      schemaHrn - The HRN of the schema
      updatePermissionRequest - The permission request

    • updateSchemaPermission

      public SchemasApi.UpdateSchemaPermissionBuilder updateSchemaPermission()

      public SchemasApi withConfig(ApiConfiguration apiConfig)
